docs.snippet: Confronting Beijing over trade abuses is not without merit. But rejecting economic alliances opens the way to Chinese initiatives around the region.

headline.print_headline: Who Wins in Trump’s China Policy? China
headline.main: Trump’s China Policy Has a Flaw: It Makes China the Winner

docs.snippet: On the economics and politics of America’s growing economic disunion.
African-Americans know what it feels like to be ignored by those in power. Thanks to Trump, the rest of America is getting a taste of that now.

headline.print_headline: We’re All in the Ghetto Now
headline.main: We’re All in the Ghetto Now

docs.snippet: As the Trump administration prepares to roll out tariffs on Chinese goods, it is also planning a much more strategic strike, this time on investment.

headline.print_headline: White House Weighs Emergency Law to Curb Chinese Investment
headline.main: White House Looks to Use Emergency Law to Halt Chinese Investment

docs.snippet: President Trump said that American troops would receive the largest pay raise in a decade and that Democrats fought against a solution for Dreamers. Neither claim is true.
In a speech this week, the president laid out a plan to address the crisis that was at turns thin on details and alarming in content.

headline.main: Trump’s Bluster on the Opioid Epidemic

docs.snippet: Republican state lawmakers have introduced a bill that would outlaw abortion, period. It’s unconstitutional, but that’s the point.

headline.main: An Ohio Bill Would Ban All Abortions. It’s Part of a Bigger Plan.

docs.snippet: The link between immigration and crime exists in the imaginations of Americans, and nowhere else.

headline.main: The Myth of the Criminal Immigrant

docs.snippet: In a shift in strategy, the White House may impose import quotas to prevent too much foreign metal from flooding into the United States.

headline.main: U.S. Exempts Some Allies From Tariffs, but May Opt for Quotas

docs.snippet: With a possible government shutdown looming this weekend, the House and Senate passed a vast spending plan that funds the government through September.

headline.print_headline: $1.3 Trillion Spending Bill Is Passed on to the Senate
headline.main: Congress Approves $1.3 Trillion Spending Bill, Averting a Shutdown
